page.title: 13The Cricket Match
page.content: This annual event takes place around Midsummers Day in the school playground. The traditional{School and {Mums}versus{Dads Cricket Match}goes back many years and has some definite if not unique{rules.} 1.{Every child}between 7 and 9 takes part _ over 20 children this year. 2. No child is out until they have{ {scored}at least one run. 3. The umpire heavily{biased}_ in favour of the school of course. 4. The scorer must know how to cheat {fairly.} 5. A vigorous ball hit out of the playground or over the roof means{four {runs and out. { 6. The school always wins _ just. This is a{social}occasion causing much merriment featuring large Dads with small bats, a surprising number of dropped catches, wides and no-balls.
